channel.title: Compiler ffs
channel.description:
ok i just started my very first server last night and i have been coding stuff like commands, npc autospawns, npcdrops and stuff like that but some of the codes i put in the server didnt seem to update or thats what i thought it was called. i thought after i put in a code i had to exit the server and client to "update it". then i found out what i was supposed to do was compile it. so i tried it and i got an error like "javac: file not found *.java" so i googled around for a few hours also went throught like 30 pages on this topic and found out that its something to do with the PATH environment variables..so i google around for another few hours and find out that that mean some files put themselfs infront of it or something and i need to fix the PATH so i went to SYSTEMproperties>advanced>environment variables and changed the PATH one to "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin" and edited the compiler to "@echo off title simple compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause"
then i try to compile it and i still get "javac: file not found:*.java" also i looked through a bunch of folders untill i found the actual "javac" file i do have it on my computer.
pleasseeeee help me ahah

item.title: Compiler ffs
item.dc:creator: @I_am_beast I am beast
item.description:
@I_am_beast wrote:

@echo off title Compiler "C:/Program Files/Java\jdk1.6.0_21/bin/javac.exe" -d ./bin ./src/*.java pause

That’s what is in my compiler. Hope that helps.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler ffs
item.dc:creator: @mynameisjbag mynameisjbag
item.description:
@mynameisjbag wrote:

soooo i changes the compiler from

“@echo off
title Compiler
“C:/Program Files/Java\jdk1.6.0_21/bin/javac” *.java
pause”

to

“@echo off
Title Compiler
“C:/Program Files/Java/jdk1.6.0_21/bin/javac.exe” *.java
pause”

like you said and changed the server run file from

“@echo off
cd Bin
java -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server
exit”

to

@echo off
title YOURSERVERNAMEHERE Scape
echo RUNESPACE IZ PRO
echo RUNESPACE IZ PRO
echo RUNESPACE IZ PRO
echo RUNESPACE IZ PRO
echo RUNESPACE IZ PRO
echo RUNESPACE IZ PRO
echo RUNESPACE IZ PRO
echo RUNESPACE IZ PRO
echo RUNESPACE IZ PRO
echo RUNESPACE IZ PRO
echo RUNESPACE IZ PRO
echo RUNESPACE IZ PRO
echo RUNESPACE IZ PRO
java -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server"

and i try to start the server and the cmd box pops up for a split second and dissapears. same thing with the client. also when i compile is just says nothing for a few seconds then “Press any key to continue” and that whats its saposed to do right?
also my server worked fine until i compiled it

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler ffs
item.dc:creator: @mynameisjbag mynameisjbag
item.description:
@mynameisjbag wrote:

o kwoot it compiles now… but not neither my client or server will open… and they would befor… i dont get it …

item.title: Compiler ffs
item.dc:creator: @mynameisjbag mynameisjbag
item.description:
@mynameisjbag wrote:

ok i changes my PATH to “C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin” and this is where the javac file is on my computer right? if i add \javac to the end it runs the java compiler but i cannot get the servers compiler to work. please help if been stuck with this problem for so long… iv been coding my server and i cant even log on it now untill i compile it.

omgggggggggggggggggggg i think i got it!!!
i changes the path back to “C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac”

and changed the compiler to

“@echo off
title Compiler
“C:/Program Files/Java\jdk1.6.0_21/bin/javac” *.java
pause”

then took the compiler and moved it from the server file into the src folder like you said and presto! i think it compiled… only problem … it gave me 2 errors

annnnnd now my server wont start up. i click run server and the cmd screen flashes and dissapears. did i f*** something up? all i wasnted was to compile my serve …gah

ok i fixed one of the errors im having trouble with the 2nd tho the compiler says

“potions.java:1: class, interface, or enum expected
FFimport java.io.*;
^
1 error”

i cant really locate what i need to fix

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler ffs
item.dc:creator: @bowzer bowzer
item.description:
@bowzer wrote:

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java

in that, change your JDK to what your classpath is.

jdk1.6.0_21

for example, my classpath is set to

jdk1.6.0_22

so thats what id replace the jdk with.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler ffs
item.dc:creator: @Project_Realm Project Realm
item.description:
@Project_Realm wrote:

The problem isn’t the javac part; it’s the “*.java” part. Pretty much, wherever your compiler is located, there aren’t any .java files to compile. That’s why the error is occurring. Try finding a folder (maybe called “src”) which should have a bunch of .java files in it. Put the compiler in there, and run it again. It should work, but because I don’t know how your server is setup, I don’t know if it will.

EDIT: The “src” folder should be in your server folder. For instance, all your server files should be inside one large folder. Within that folder should be many other folders, such as “bin”, “cache”, and the “src” one I was talking about. It doesn’t have to be called “src,” but that’s the most common name.

Read full topic
